summary: 2004 to PresentCharles Schwab Co.Solutions architect responsible for security of all UNIX operating systems, including privileged access.Currently supporting protection of sensitive data by encryption and tokenization methodologies. This includes data in flight or data at rest.  This also includes key management (separation of duties) supporting the encryption and tokenization processes.I am a subject matter expert in password vaulting technologies, as well as third party LDAP authentication clients for Unix.Previous duties include the certification of the various flavors of UNIX, active/passive clustering technologies, and LDAP authentication in the UNIX space.   2003 to 2004Contractor with Glotel Inc.Onsite work at Charles Schwab.Migrated all UNIX systems from the Resonate load balancing product to the Cisco load balancers. 2002 to 2003Contractor at CDI Corp.Onsite work with Honeywell.Maintained all DNS domains for corporate Honeywell.  Managed all class B and class C address space.2001 to 2002Contractor at Alliance ConsultingOnsite work with Dial.Performed standard changes and upgrades to all UNIX servers at the Dial data center.2001 to 2001Expanets of ArizonaWas the onsite HP-UX systems engineer and EMC engineer for various customers of Expanets.1999 to 2001Buzzeo Inc.  Architected the network layout, negotiated contracts with voice and data T1 lines with various vendors.1997 to 1999Sprint ParanetOnsite work for Allied Signal Engines Division.Performed team lead functions for a team of 7 unix system administrators.  Setup a change management structure for site to manage change in their computing environment.  Helped merge 2 NIS domains into a single domain.
